Reviews.Title: “Reasonably priced lodging in the Napa Valley.”
Reviews.Author: gcjones
Reviews.Content: Lodging in the Napa wine country is expensive. The El Bonita Motel is a reasonably priced choice if you can overlook a few things. It is on Highway 29, but the road noise is usually minimal at night. Our room, on the second floor, was unexceptional, however it did have a nice balcony. The TV was as vintage as the hotel, they need to upgrade to flat screen TVs. Interestingly, the walls were devoid of any decor - it would seem apropos to hang some Napa-related scenery/art - even a few pieces would have livened things up. Breakfast was a disappointment. Cold cereal, a few pastries, some fruit, coffee and Sunny D (!?) - not even real OJ. I recommend you drive/walk the quarter mile or so south to Dean & Deluca and get some real coffee, croissants, cheeses, etc. to start your day - you'll be glad you did. Is this a destination lodging? Not really. Would we stay here again? Yes, as it is a good value for the area, and besides, you don't go to Napa to sit in your hotel room and watch Wheel of Fortune. It is absolutely convenient to all that the Napa area has to offer.

Reviews.Title: “A California Motel that you will want to check out”
Reviews.Author: Pasha55711
Reviews.Content: This is a Motel that is situated by the two lane busy Main road. The rate integrity is not what they go by as the rate changed to a higher one upon check in after it was confirmed verbally by the reservationist. The local building laws prevent any new construction and the El Bonita enjoys the demand caused by restriction with over priced motel rooms in demand. If you prefer the noise of the road, you can shut down the room unit A/C. If not you can have the "white noise" of the A/C unit. While the rooms are clean, the proximity of your window to the parking lot and the cars is annoyingly within close quarters and you realize that when you can hear the conversation of motel guests in their own parked cars. This is a town that boasts some of the best restaurants in the state [and maybe in the country] and yet this Motel serves coffee that appallingly low in quality and taste, with a continental set up that is no better than the chain Motels disbursed around the country.For an additional $50 or higher a night there are several other small Hotels/Motels that I will look into when I come back for business. When I called at 6:30 AM to inquire about few things I was greeted with a sleepy, curt reservationist

Reviews.Title: “Great price”
Reviews.Author: Loompa1
Reviews.Content: Recently took a class at the Culinary Institute of America. This motel was convenient and clean. The rate was great, the breakfast a disappointment.... but a nice bang for the buck.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful budget bargain”
Reviews.Author: vicdriver
Reviews.Content: What a super pleasant surprise at $79 in the heart of high dollar establishments! If your looking for the full five star experience, go spend $150 down the road. Budget travelers to the northern California wine country can't go wrong here. The exterior of the hotel makes it seems like you're on route 66 back in the day. The interior of our room appeared to be early 90's (or maybe late 80's?) but it was super huge, as was the bathroom. Very clean (it did smell of bleach just a bit, which could be considered a good thing). All the trimmings (fridge, micro, iron, coffee, etc). I was so pleased to see a whole bunch of sugar packets instead of the two you usually get. Even two logo'd wine glasses (available for purchase $3 each) and a complimentary cork screw. We did not take advantage of the complimentary continental breakfast (which was very basic and served in the lobby - not a ton of places to sit) but did grab some fruit and a packaged muffin. Orange juice was fake Sunny D. don't let that deter you. Location was good, about a mile from St Helena town center.

Reviews.Title: “Surprisingly Good!”
Reviews.Author: Brian B
Reviews.Content: We were pleasantly surprised, given the (relatively) low price! Comofortable, clean rooms, great location. And - the free wireless internet was extremely fast (12 MB / 6 MB)! We will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Best deal in Napa Valley”
Reviews.Author: longhornwine
Reviews.Content: Three things matter to me when I'm looking for a place to stay on my Napa trips: Location, price, and comfort. Location because at the end of a day of tasting wine, you don't want to be driving very far to your hotel. Price because Napa Valley is a world class destination now, and it can get very pricey! Comfort because nothing is worse than shelling out a lot of bucks, only to find your room is not even close to worth it. El Bonita is located in the very heart of the valley, on the south edge of St. Helena, on Hwy 29. You can actually walk to several famous wineries and restaurants. Score 5 stars for location! During the "season", the price is not so good, but from fall to spring you can score $90 rates! This is the best time, as tourist traffic is down, but weather is still great, on average. The rooms have been refurbished, and are quite nice, though small. (For larger rooms, one can stay in the back area, but these cost more.) The deal is on the poolside, front rooms. Beds are only Queen size, but comfortable. Bathrooms are small, but nice.....and the tile floors are warmed somehow! The office, which is just a few steps away, offers coffee and continental breakfast. Pets are also allowed, though there is a fee. If you come to Napa for wine tasting and learning, this is the ideal place. If you want more of an experience of a lifetime, with lodging on a world class scale, and don't mind paying far more, then try Yountville!

Reviews.Title: “Good value in Healdsburg”
Reviews.Author: jujripper
Reviews.Content: This motel is a reasonable value for the money. It is somewhat plain with older fixtures. It is more interesting than a chain motel and considering the price of other properties in the area it provides good accommodation. They are doing some remodeling but have left many details unfinished. We had a water leak in the toilet base because it had not been tightened. The manager arrived promptly and fixed it. He was a very pleasant Cuban and very interesting to talk to. I would recommend this to anyone seeking reasonable lodging on a budget.

Reviews.Title: “Price is an indicator of quality”
Reviews.Author: HedoHP
Reviews.Content: In a very expensive tourist hot spot, El Bonita Motel stands out for its history and price. The location of the motel is excellent as it is located on main street. However, as with most things you get what you pay for. While this hotel is an excellent value and has received good reviews, it is just that a value motel. Upon arriving I checked in with the not overly friendly, yet courteous staff. My room was ground level on the back side in the thirties. It was chilly in Napa Valley so I found my room a very chilly 54 degrees upon arrival. After boosting the heat several times I finally found a tolerable temp of 75 degrees by the second day. I was in a king room and worried upon seeing the bed I may need a step stool to get in it. The bed was so high from the ground was actually uncomfortable getting in and out. The bathroom was probably the worst part of the room. The jetted tub was heavy with chipped and peeling paint; not to mention the yellow stain line around most of the tub. Getting in and out of the tub/shower also proved to be difficult as there was about a foot and a half edge....good thing there was a grab bar! Also, the area is pretty safe, however I feel the need to mention there were also sliding glass doors that opened to a shared grassy area. There was a continetal breakfast offered, which was ok and included some prepackaged breads and muffins, Sunny D, coffee and fruit. While this hotel was generally clean, it offered nothing extra and the poor condition of the rooms would make me think twice about staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “El Bonita motel is a good value in St. Helena”
Reviews.Author: Phil R
Reviews.Content: St. Helena is a beautiful little town nestled in the heart of the Napa valley. It has become a destination for both domestic and international tourists. Consequently, room rates for hotels, inns, and B&Bs in this area are quite high. El Bonita motel offers a bit of relief from this never ending price escalation. My wife and I stayed here 5 nights at the end of December with an average room rate of $121 plus 14% tax. There are several different buildings in the motel. We chose a king bed Garden room. The room was fairly spacious, containing 2 big comfortable easy chairs as well as a small glass topped table and chair set that looked like it belonged on a patio. There was a microwave and refrigerator and some dishes. Decor is absolutely "motel-standard". It was quite cold during our visit and the management had no problem providing extra blankets. (Recently at several hotels, I have been told that "there are no blankets available." The only negative would have to be the continental breakfast, available from 7:30 to 10:30. There are 4 kinds of cold cereal, instant oatmeal, bananas, apples, and oranges. (The oranges were sporadically available during the 5 days and starting on the 3rd day the bananas were bright green and not edible.) They provide apple juice boxes like you would give your elementary school child and bottles of orange drink. (Water plus sugar plus a little orange juice). Pastries are individually wrapped supermarket type. The clerk told me that the health department did not allow them to put out fresh pastries from the local bakery. On one day there was no milk available for coffee or cereal and the desk clerk said in so many words, "I can't do anything about it, I just work here". So, enjoy the room, and with the money you save, go out to breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Impressed”
Reviews.Author: Travelur
Reviews.Content: Finally decided to try out El Bonita after having stayed at other places in St. Helena for years. I was plesently surprised/impressed. The motel is very well maintained, the service is excellent, it is priced very well, and the locaiton is pretty good (keeping the price in mind). It's not fancy, but it is clean and simple - and they even had the outdoor pool heated during the winter! Did the walk to Tra Vigne and to downtown St. Helena. El Bonita is about 8/10's of a mile from downtown St. Helena, of which about 1/4 of a mile is a strech without sidewalks and lighting. So just be prepared for that. Other than the short hike to town (but welcomed because you can walk off dinner), I really like El Bonita and will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Value”
Reviews.Author: 2VAGuys
Reviews.Content: El Bonita is so wonderfully located in St. Helena. You can actually walk to Tra Vigne, which is a good thing. The pries are unlike any in the area - low to reasonable. If you like clean and serviceable motels, this is among the best. The grounds are great. I'd stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Thank you El Bonita!”
Reviews.Author: JanLeary_11
Reviews.Content: I just want to thank you for a great experience. Four of us stayed in your King George Suite. The room was delightful and perfect for us. The large living room gave us space to sit and chat, have coffee and drink some wine. Upon arriving home I found I had left some items in the room. No problem! A quick call to Cedrick at the desk and the items were promptly mailed and arrived in just a couple of days. Thanks to all the staff for keeping the place clean and inviting; the atmosphere relaxing; and the price was a bargain!

Reviews.Title: “nice place for a great price”
Reviews.Author: mmcgannon
Reviews.Content: Great location - you can walk into St. Helena. Garden view rooms were spacious and quiet. Great price - most Napa Valley lodging is very expensive. If they had drinkable in-room coffee, I would have had no complaints at all.

Reviews.Title: “Not so great”
Reviews.Author: travelingbarbie08
Reviews.Content: Didn't actually stay overnight here. Had a reservation for two nights but when we saw the room, we changed our mind. The outside of the motel is quaint and attractive but rooms were very cheap looking. Furniture and decor looked very old. Staff was very good about refunding our money.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable place to stay in Napa Valley with a great pool.”
Reviews.Author: Cream_Crackered_Dad
Reviews.Content: We needed accommodation for weekend in Napa Valley for our family of 5. El Bonita provided a two room suite at $279 per night plus tax. Cheaper than getting 2 hotel rooms but seemed pricey in hindsight. Most iikely a case of supply and demand. Rooms were roomy and clean. Bathroom a bit dated but functional. Aircon quiet and effective. Complimentary breakfast of coffee and pastries pretty good but tended to run out early. I'd give it a very good rating, but only just!

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced-decent accommodations-great location”
Reviews.Author: Williwillinui
Reviews.Content: I loved my stay in St. Helena, but I was underwhelmed with this hotel, especially considering the price was over $200. We did enjoy the pool and the convenient location.

Reviews.Title: “We loved it and would definitely come and stay again!”
Reviews.Author: CherylandBrett
Reviews.Content: Great room, clean, very quiet, with microwave and small 'fridge. Coffee maker, hair dryer, darling patio. We chose a room at the back of the hotel in the Homestead unit, farthest away from the busy road. Absolutely quiet and beautiful location! Decent Continental breakfast each morning with the biggest strawberries we've ever had!

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant Surprise!”
Reviews.Author: charkoosta
Reviews.Content: We usually try to stay at national chain hotel/motels as we have had some pretty bad experiences in ones that are not. We had a queen room in the back of the motel, on the top floor. It was so nice a quiet and no lights from the neighborhood or businesses! The room was clean and quite comfortable. The staff was very friendly and helpful. And, really good coffee in the breakfast room, too!

Reviews.Title: “Terrible Service”
Reviews.Author: BC_Travellers24
Reviews.Content: Were recommended this hotel by a couple of strangers we met in San Francisco, so tried it out. The place was almost empty and the listed prices at the desk, for "High Season" (started a day before we got there) was $110 and up. We just wanted to stay and move on, so asked for the best price, which was $149. We thought that didn't agree with the prices listed, but were basically told to take it or leave it. Seemed like a little flexibility would be good if there is 10% occupancy... We didn't feel like looking any further so stayed, nice enough room and the pool looked great, but we didnt have time to try it out. We planned on leaving early in the morning anyway, but at 0800 the leaf blower fired up. It was a good thing we were planning on heading out, that would have been pretty disruptive. Judging by our reception and others in this string of reviews, the staff would likely not have cared. Will not recommend to others, even strangers in a bar...

Reviews.Title: “Unforgivable front desk service!”
Reviews.Author: justthefact
Reviews.Content: Upon check-out, haggard looking man was working the front desk. They must have needed any warm body; I can't imagine a business knowingly hiring this person. We were checking out 10 minutes AFTER breakfast started and I asked if they had any bananas (they had them the day before and I'm gluten intolerant so I cannot eat any of the other breakfast items). He told me they would get around to putting them out in awhile. Told him we had to leave to catch a flight and you would have thought I shot his first born. In front of myself and other customers, he slammed down the computer mouse, sighed, rolled his eyes and huffed while walking the four steps it took to get the banana. We all stood there in shock. I've stayed at this hotel on and off for 15 years, this guy makes me question if I'll ever return.

Reviews.Title: “Location, but not fancy.”
Reviews.Author: customerp
Reviews.Content: Decent enough... and quiet, but it's all about the location. Staff is great, place is clean, and breakfast is decent with great coffee. Desk people could smile a little more, but no complaints whatsoever. Overall, beat expectations.

Reviews.Title: “Fairly nice and reasonable”
Reviews.Author: ChilliLondon
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 1 night on tuesday 7th Sept. It was on the side of the highway, not far from the town centre. The rooms were spacious, and quite good value for money. The staff were not friendly and were a little unhelpful. The pool and hot jacuzzi they have outside was def the highlight.

Reviews.Title: “Dependable”
Reviews.Author: Winewish
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here before and appreciate the value and location. This trip, my first night was in Room #203 which is not for those who wish to sleep in. It backs up to the office, and any movement early in the morning is clearly heard thru the walls. The rest of my stay was in Room #1 which is convenient. Others have mentioned the street noise- but I have not found it to be a problem. The room is well organized although for those of us with too many gadgets to charge the electrical plugs are difficult to access. The bathroom, while small was very usable, and immaculately clean. Housekeeping staff are very good. Coffee and breakfast is continental +, and included which adds to the excellent value. I didn't use the pool, but it was pretty and inviting. I will be back, and recommend to those who appreciate a good deal, and are spending the time out and about, not lounging in their rooms.

Reviews.Title: “If you're after a memorable accommodation...”
Reviews.Author: AndyPep
Reviews.Content: If you're after a memorable accommodation as you explore the neighbouring wineries then this isn't it. That said it's a perfectly suitable place to lay your head in between wine stops and we'd use it again on that basis. Pool and sauna were welcomed at the end of the day.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, too bad the service wasn't also”
Reviews.Author: tougo
Reviews.Content: We picked up our keys and tried to enter our room, but the safety latch was closed. The lady in the office didn't believe me since the room was "not occupied." She finally came with me to look and my frustrated husband had checked all the windows and the back door for a way in to no avail. She was confused and no help at all, my husband got his tools out of the car and pried the latch off letting us in. He also replaced the latch once we were in. Nothing was said in the way of thank you, or I'm sorry and it was a crappy way to start our visit to the valley. We were not expecting much from this hotel but a cheap place to stay in a pricey area and that's exactly what we got. The bed was hard, and the furnashings were worn. The pool was heated and we had it pretty much to ourselves in the afternoons. We tried to save a few dollars by staying here, but would spend a few next time to stay somewhere nicer.

Reviews.Title: “great gem”
Reviews.Author: julsblas
Reviews.Content: My sister, brother and I stayed at El Bonita to attend a wedding nearby recently. While we were a little skeptical about the place , as the pictures were plain etc., and the cost was quite lower than other places around the area, we were very pleased in the end. We booked the 3rd floor suite which was clean, private, and comfortably housed 3 of us. The pool seemed to be used throughout the day, and looked very nice, too. the breakfast offered in the main common area, gave us a good start, although quite basic (fresh fruit, cereal, danishes, muffins) and the coffee was excellent. The staff were also accommodating & friendly, although we didn't really have any issues. If you stay in St. Helene, you must go to the bakery on the Main street..it is amazing!! All in all great price, for rooms that offer clean, quiet place to stay in a beautiful area to visit. Hope to return soon!

Reviews.Title: “Good value for a great location”
Reviews.Author: genelary
Reviews.Content: We stayed 2 nights while visiting Napa valley and attending the July 4 celebration in St. Helena. You could not find a better location for visiting the wine country than the El Bonita. Poolside room was small, but comfortable. Bed was just ok, but could have been better. A/C was annoying, cycling off and on all night. Best room rate in Napa valley.

Reviews.Title: “Good Stay - Know what you're getting...”
Reviews.Author: Jotravels2
Reviews.Content: Just returned from 2 night stay with hubby and 8 yo child. Good choice if you want to be centrally located within Napa Valley and not pay a fortune. Very lovely grounds, nice sized room, small yet adequate pool for hot summer days. Only thing I found strange was that it seemed as if some local families or the families of workers used the pool. Didn't cause a problem yet seemed a bit odd. Very easy to get to Yountville, Oakville and just on the outskirts of St. Helena plus the Silverado Trail. Wish I were still there...

Reviews.Title: “Nice comfy place”
Reviews.Author: Pippsan
Reviews.Content: We chose El Bonita after reading the good reviews here and our three night stay didn't disappoint. Our poolside room was very clean with brand new quality fittings. Really the only negative point was the lack of proper duvet as the bed only had sheet and an old blanket. Free wifi was included plus there was a guest computer with a colour printer at the reception. Breakfast was good, fresh fruit, cereal, pastries, coffee, juices. Pool and the hot tub were clean. Sauna was great. The motel was very close to wineries and within walking distance to the town. I'd definitely stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, great value!”
Reviews.Author: tstandr
Reviews.Content: What a find! We stayed here mid-week and the price could not be beat. The accomodations are very comfortable with updated bathrooms that even have radiant heat underneath the new travertine tile. There wasn't a bathtub in our room, but the shower stall had a really pretty river rock floor. The bed was also comfortable though it's not a pillow-top like you find in most hotels these days. They have a hot tub and pool that seemed to be popular with the guests. This motel is located right on Hwy 29, but we couldn't hear the traffic inside our room. The continental breakfast was a selection of cold cereal, pastries and donuts, fruit, coffee, juice. It all looked delicious. The location is so great because it's just south of the main street in St. Helena and just north of a ton of awesome wineries, which would make wine tasting and dining very easy to do. I plan to stay here every time I'm in the area. It's perfect!

Reviews.Title: “Our Family Loved It!”
Reviews.Author: ThisFamilyTravels
Reviews.Content: Stayed here one night with my husband and two young (yet well-behaved) children. After reading the previous reviews, we opted for a room in the back to avoid the street noise. This motel sits right on the busy street, so during rush hour it can be a bit noisy. We never had any problems with this. Our second-story, end unit room was SO quiet. We had a sliding patio door with a balcony that overlooked a beautiful meadow with oak trees. (I'll try to upload photos later.) As the sun set, it was really serene. We enjoyed the beautiful, yet empty pool area. There was one other couple at a nearby table enjoying a bottle of wine. The pool was exceptionally warm - say 90 degrees - and the staff told us that they heat it year round. Loved the pool area...there was also a spa and SAUNA which we did not use. The rooms around the pool area (motor court) were cute and if not for the noise, wouldn't hesitate to book one of these. Nightime lighting on site and on the trees added to the charm. Noticed that other guests had bicycles delivered to the resort by a local biking company. Neat option. Grounds were beautiful and manicured nicely. Many places around the resort to sit down with a good book. Breakfast area was a bit cramped, but we sat out on the patio by the fountain and that made it nice. Food was simple, but fresh. Fresh berries, cereal, and fresh pastries (as opposed to previously frozen.) My husband commented that he thinks the pastries were provided by a bakery...they were good. This was a perfect overnight stay for our little family. Not only would we stay here again, but we'd recommend it. Price was right at $109 for a larger room. While in the area, we took the kids to the Napa Valley Olive Oil "Manufactory" (a no-frills hidden gem my parents and I have been visiting for 30+ years) which is in downtown St. Helena, the Calistoga geyser (kids LOVED the animals), and "Taylor's Refresher" local drive-in for a simple supper. All within a 10-minute drive from the motel. Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice”
Reviews.Author: FWA2006
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for several nights and found it to be very nice. There are tons of hotels in the area and most are upscale and pricey. For the amount of time we spent in the room (not much) this was perfect. This is strip style motel with parking right outside your door. Some of the pictures may look plain and homey but El Bonita is conveniently located, is clean, has a continental breakfast each morning, has computer/internet access in the lobby (great for checking flight information and printing boarding passes), and has a pool and hot tub. I'd stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, Great location, a real "find".”
Reviews.Author: c_hendryx
Reviews.Content: The modest appearance from the street hides a real "gem". Room was clean & very nice. We had our small dog, and generally a "dog room" is the worst, but not here! I couldn't beleive they still had the pool heated in November and it was great. The location being so close to town was fantastic, not to mention having several wineries within walking distance. We will definitely make it ourplace to stay in St Helena. C&C - Seattle

Reviews.Title: “Affordable lodging in St. Helena”
Reviews.Author: pucgal
Reviews.Content: Having been born and raised in Napa Valley I find it difficult to pay the $$$ asked of tourists for lodging when I return home. It is comforting to know that the El Bonita still offers dependable lodging at an affordable price. We stay in the back rooms to avoid the early morning commercial traffic. The rooms are clean and offer basic amenities. One must hope for quiet and respectful neighbors as the doors between rooms are paper thin. Obviously I am sensitive to lots of noise, but other than that - good place to stay. The staff accommodated our requests quickly and in a pleasant manner.

Reviews.Title: “small yet lovely”
Reviews.Author: sillyamiga
Reviews.Content: the room was small, but exactly what we wanted for a one night stay in napa valley. It's right off the main road, but very little noise. There is free breakfast which had a sampling of donuts, pastries, cerals, yogurt, fruit, and oatmeal with juices and coffee. There is a computer in the lobby for the internet and a hot tub/pool just outside.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect place to rest our heads”
Reviews.Author: two-lucky-daughters
Reviews.Content: We spent one night in St. Helena and stayed at the El Bonita "The Beauty" . The grounds were beautiful, the rooms were comfortable, and the staff was very pleasant. We stayed in the back of the motel, away from the street, so we didn't hear any traffic at all.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, nice room”
Reviews.Author: maskvg
Reviews.Content: The King George Suite with two bedrooms, 1 bath and family room area was nice for travelling with friends and very economical ($260 inc. tax). It had a small kitchen area and table for meals. The sauna and heated pool were also very nice after a long day of tasting wines at all of the nearby wineries. Go to the the Wine Garage in Calistoga for great wine under $25 and helpful recommendations regarding wineries to visit. The road noise is noticable during the day but didn't bother us at night.

Reviews.Title: “Best Motel I have ever stayed in”
Reviews.Author: jar2009
Reviews.Content: This place had everything. It was a great Location; within walking distance to numerous vineyards to get lashed and Ana's Cantina to get more lashed. It had an amazing view. Great rooms and decor. Very comfortable and accomadating. The staff were fantastic. They let us stay at the pool and jacuzzi until 3am crushing wine and screaming nonsensically. No complaints or police. If you are lucky, you may find my freinds shoes in the bushes out front. It was great. I would recommend it to both, groups of freinds and families. What a great place.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, Great pool”
Reviews.Author: VandA2009
Reviews.Content: We stayed for one night at the El Bonita motel. Check in was efficient and informative. We stayed in a poolside room, but road noise did not intrude. The pool and hot tub were great. The inclusive breakfast was also pleasant, in a nice bright room. The wineries, shops and restaurants of St Helena are all close by. It was not cheap by motel standards, but I guess that's typical for St Helena. I would have no problem in recommending the El Bonita.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great value, clean, and free breakfast and wireless”
Reviews.Author: DrDean01
Reviews.Content: We found this motel in Wine Spectator and checked it out on TripAdvisor. Great recommendation by both. We were very happy with our room, which was about 25 yards off Highway 29, the main wine country road. Road noise was not a factor. The room had a fridge and microwave. Very nice shower. The pool, hot tub, and sauna were very nice surprises. The free breakfast offered a nice variety and there is a quaint courtyard attached to the small lobby where you can eat outside. SPEND THE MONEY YOU SAVE HERE FOR BUYING SOME GREAT WINE OR EATING AT THE MANY WONDERFUL AREA RESTAURANTS!

Reviews.Title: “Great value in St. Helena”
Reviews.Author: MarkfromtheIsland
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the El Bonita for 3 nights while taking a course at the Culinary Institute in St. Helena. We picked the El Bonita primarily for the price as most accommodation in Napa was very expensive. We were pleasantly surprised by what we got. The room was modest, to be sure, and very 60's. It was clean, though, and the bed was comfortable without that annoying 'roll-into-the-middle' feature so common to hotel beds. The bathroom had been recently renovated and was immaculate - with a river rock shower floor and all glass shower wall/door. It passed the most critical test for me - good water pressure and lots of hot water. Being a MO-tel the rooms all border immediately upon the parking lot so people arriving after you're in bed trying to sleep are very much a problem. We always travel with earplugs, though, and that solved the difficulty very nicely. Without earplugs I would have had a lot of difficulty here because of that. People tend to forget that they need to talk quietly at 1am when they're right outside someone's window. All in all I would highly recommend the El Bonita. It's not 5 star - that's for sure - but if you're like us you only need a motel to SLEEP. We were out at 7:30am and back at 11pm. I don't need 5 star to sleep. Oh... and if you're going to the CIA let them know - there's a discount.

Reviews.Title: “Why stay anywhere else?”
Reviews.Author: dancingnancy
Reviews.Content: Great deal. Cool-looking place. A huge room, with attractive furniture, a fridge and microwave for $100 on an off season midweek night. Free wireless internet. A short drive up the road to the restaurants and shops of St. Helena. Of course, you don’t expect the smoothest sheets or fluffiest towels. I would have traded the giant whirlpool tub for a smaller one that drained properly…but that should be an easy fix. Stay at El Bonita and have more $$$ to spend on wine!

Reviews.Title: “Great value & great for families”
Reviews.Author: vintagemom
Reviews.Content: My 2 teens & I love to visit the Wine Country - especially St. Helena. We always try to stay @ El Bonita. Clean, reasonable in price, & close to just about everything. The pool is heated - something my teens really enjoy. (Mom hangs out in the jacuzzi!) Yes, it is a bit "no frills," but what you really need is there. My only complaint is that the front desk staff need some polishing, as there is quite a bit of variability between the staff. Some are super friendly & competent @ their job, sometimes they can be downright rude. Bottom line, this is the best place for your money - which leaves you more dollars for the great restaurants around town! The perfect place for families, too.

Reviews.Title: “Bonita is good value and well kept”
Reviews.Author: Clyde E
Reviews.Content: July 16, 08 Just returned from 2 days and 1 night in the Wine Country. The El Bonita Hotel provides very good value for the cost, is clean, and the service was excellent. It's right next to the main road into St Helena. The poolside rooms are pr obably incredibly noisy. We lounged around the pool to the roar. The grounds are well kept with pretty flowers and lots of plants. The units in back, the Homestead units, are roomy and completely sheltered from the noise. The Garden units should also allow a quiet night's sleep. This is 3-star but very good value for the cost.

Reviews.Title: “Not a palace, but excellent of its type”
Reviews.Author: lemons1
Reviews.Content: I first spied El Bonita in 1981, and have wanted to stay there ever since. It's clearly a throwback to the Mom 'n Pop spots of my youth, although none of those ever had microwaves, fridges or ironing boards. One local described it to us as cleaner than many of the B & Bs in the area, and it certainly is spotless. Lovely, lovely roses this time of year, which is a little early for the pool, and quite busy, even on a Monday night in mid-May. The windows open, another pleasant thing, although it means a few late-arriving guests had their conversations inadvertently overheard. The continental breakfast is coffee, juice, cold cereal and pastries. Extremely weak coffee, alas, but excellent pastry, all very fresh including high-quality croissants. For people who understand what a motel is supposed to be like this is a great spot. For folks who want a four-star hotel experience, this isn't it, and doesn't pretend to be. But if you want a place to crash while you enjoy the Napa Valley and not spend Big Bucks, this is your best bet.

Reviews.Title: “Very pleasantly surprised!”
Reviews.Author: writergirl77
Reviews.Content: The website for this motel does not do it justice. I wasn't expecting grand accomodations as a budget traveler, but I should have believed the rave reviews on TA and the promise of a hotel close to the towns of St. Helena and Yountville! They were right... This is no roadside motel. The courtyards are beautifully charming with water fountains and landscaping. The kidney-shaped pool is surrounded by teak loungers and grass. The pool area also has a hot tub and sauna. There are more teak chaises and tables in other grassy areas of this verdant property. I didn't get to enjoy these ammenities much because it was unseasonably cool during my visit, but I imagine they would be incredibly tempting in the summer. As for the rooms, there are in three buildings. The main building is one story and the rooms face the road - that could be rather noisy at night, I imagine. This building also houses the office and breakfast area/lobby. The lobby has a couple tables for breakfast and a seating area as well as a desktop computer with free internet access (the entire property offers free wifi). Breakfast is a rather bland continental affair - no toast or hardboiled eggs. Just cold cereal, oatmeal packets, pillowy croissants, danish, coffee, juice, yogurt and whole fresh fruit. You can also take your breakfast back to your room or eat it outside on the patio. There is another one-story building set back further from the road and a two-story building where we stayed, on the second floor. The room had a spacious bathroom, sink outside of the bathroom, fridge and counter prep area which is convenient for assembling snacks and lunches. The two queen bedrooms are spacious. Our room had a quiet terrace with chairs that was nice for a glass of wine in the evening (glasses and corkscrew provided in each room). You are not going to get the luxury of a $500-per-night hotel, but for $155 per night off season we feel we did very well. The grounds are so clean and well-maintained. We saw someone actually cleaning the ceilings of the outdoor hallways... twice. There isn't a spot on the balconies or stairs that lacks fresh paint. This isn't a B&B where you'll get good recommendations for restaurants and help making your winery appointments for tastings and tours - the front desk is there to check you in and out and that's it. But if you want an affordable, pleasant, relaxing place to stay and you prefer anonymity to the friendly helpfulness of a B&B, this is your best pick for the Napa area. I promise.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!!”
Reviews.Author: cheffie46
Reviews.Content: Spotlessly clean, great staff, outstanding pool. My wife and I stayed for a week with three toddlers and a 15 year old- and had a very positive experience. We will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded expectations...”
Reviews.Author: Go2Yosemite
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the El Bonita Motel. The motel exceeded our expectations. It was clean and comfortable. We stayed in a king-bed room on the first floor that was part of the newer units behind the older units. Most of all, it was quiet which was a nice surprise given the fact that it is right on the main highway running from Napa to St. Helena. The continental breakfast worked out well – cereal, fruit, pastry of some sort, yogurt, juice and, of course, coffee or tea. It has a great location for exploring the wine country. It is reasonably priced.

Reviews.Title: “El Bonita - A Fantastic Home Base For A Vacation in Napa”
Reviews.Author: TorontoToo
Reviews.Content: We spent one week at El Bonita this October and were delighted with our stay there. We selected this property for its central, St. Helena location for wine country touring and, the fact that some suites have kitchenettes. I had read mixed reviews on this site so we were exceptionally pleased to find that El Bonita exceeded our expectations on all counts. The hotel's website photos accurately depict the rooms but, in our view, do not do the property full justice. We stayed in the "1 Room Suite Homestead". Here's what we liked: - The hotel grounds are beautiful, well-tended with award-winning landscaping - Although this property is situated on the highway, the pool area, sauna and guest rooms are secluded due to the numerous, beautiful trees covering the grounds. - The "Homestead" guest rooms are located at the back of the grounds and, our suite was extremely quiet. We did not hear any noise from other guests, cars etc. - Service was prompt, proffesional and courteous - our requests were always attended to with a smile and consideration - the suite itself was extremely large with a full living and dining room, huge bathroom with extra deep 2 person jacuzzi, separate, spacious bedroom, kitchenette with gas stove, microwave, bar fridge and coffee maker. We also had 2 balconies. - the suite was exceptionally clean (I am picky). As others have commented, housekeeping was always available and happy to clean your suite as soon as they knew you were heading out for the day. - balconies were spacious with potted plants, tables and chairs. Balconies were well-tended with walls/floors swept daily - there was plenty of closet/storage space - suites are air-conditioned, though air conditioning was not necessary -bed was very comfortable. Black-out draperies in suite. -free internet access in lobby, free breakfast too though we didn't partake. - property is just a couple of minutes (by car) from the centre of town, a great, central location for wine touring in Sonoma and even Napa. Some wineries are even within walking distance. Culinary Institute of America/Greystone is about 10 minutes away by car. There are restaurants within walking distance. Overall we thoroughly enjoyed having this "home away from home" in Napa. We would definitely recommend El Bonita to others without hesitation and felt this property provided excellent value.

Reviews.Title: “El Bonita - Better than Imagined”
Reviews.Author: caljl
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the El Bonita for 2 nights in Oct 07 for a wedding we were attending at a nearby winery. We stayed there because most of the wedding guests we knew were also staying there. After reading horrible reviews on Trip Advisor, I was expecting the worst. I use trip advisor to choose every hotel we ever stay at, simply because it has never let me down. I was ready to change my reservation to stay elsewhere, but I'm glad I didnt! What can I say... You drive up and see this beautiful little inn on the side of the road. With great landscaping, huge trees, and a quaint little lobby. The lady at the front desk was very friendly and helped us in every way possible. (She even called about 8 different restaurants to get us a reservation for that evening). The room was small, basic, but clean. The furniture was outdated and the mattress, well...it sucked. But the carpet, walls, an blinds were all in good condition. They just need to buy new furniture. The bath was also small, but served its purpose. The maids were right on it. As soon as we walked out, they were cleaning the room within a few minutes. The pool and spa and sauna were GREAT! Just the right temp, and clean! The location was GREAT! Right in the center of town. If you stay here, you'll like it a lot. Try to get a room closer to the middle of the inn, not closest to the road. But overall, if you have your AC/vent/heater on, it hides a lot of road noise. Suggestion: Go to the Health Spa Napa Valley for a great spa day. Great amenities and massage! Great for after those long days of wine tasting.

Reviews.Title: “Value in Napa Valley”
Reviews.Author: cheersFlorida
Reviews.Content: This hotel is an institution in Napa Valley. Central location right on highway 29 just south of St. Helena. Clean, comfortable rooms, continetal breakfast in the morning. Nice pool for lounging and guest computer if needed in lobby. August is the high season in Napa Valley and I reserved a room with 2 queen beds for $135 per night. Monday - Thursday is MUCH less expensive than Friday - Sunday stays. Qick getaway or business travel or traveling with a group this is the place.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value near St. Helena”
Reviews.Author: honeymoonseeker
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the El Bonita on a Weds night in July. Check in was smooth and the room we booked was ready upon arrival. We stayed in a room near the rear of the property. It was very large, clean and quiet. There was a back patio with a few chairs overlooking a small garden. We enjoyed the spa and pool, but agree the road traffic an be a bit distracting. The continental breakfast was fine, but nothing spectacular. This hotel/motel is a good value for Napa and for quieter rooms, request the ones away from pool and highway. The hotel is also close to the popular restaurant, Tra Vigne. It is walkable, but not in heels!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Motel”
Reviews.Author: Durwoody
Reviews.Content: We’d called the same day we needed the reservation to a few hotels in the area, most were in the $225+/night range. While on our way to check out one of the hotels, we spotted the El Bonita. The front desk clerk, Cedrick allowed me to see the room. It was small but clean, neat and kind of cute. It had a TV, small desk and queen size bed. The room was fine for 2 people. The bathroom was not huge, but contained a sink, shower and toilet. There was a microwave and small refrigerator. Our room was #11 which was right in the middle of the pool view rooms ($135/night). It really isn’t a poolview, because the pool is actually across the parking lot. This was fine for me because I was concerned about noise from the pool keeping us awake. Noise was not a problem during our stay. There is another review that mentioned the location as being on Hwy 29. It is, but we did not notice much noise esp. with the A/C on. There was one time emergency vehicles drove past, we could hear that, but it only lasted a few seconds. My husband wasn’t quite as enthused as I was about the property, but I had no problem staying here. I would recommend this property without reservations, just remember it is nice quality motel, not a hotel. The staff was helpful and friendly. There is a continental breakfast with fruit in the morning and complimentary newspapers. The grounds were very nicely landscaped, unexpected for such a small property.

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly fine for my needs”
Reviews.Author: penredj
Reviews.Content: I stayed three nights at the El Bonita in July, while traveling for business. Yes, the rooms are small, but there are some nice upgrades like heated tile floors in the bathrooms. There is in-room coffee service and a microwave and fridge. I found the room to be extremely clean and well-maintained during the course of my stay. The motel offers a nice continental breakfast service in the lobby and you can also use the lobby computer to access the internet. My room was in the front of the motel, near the pool, and there was quite a bit of traffic noise from Route 129. I ran the air conditioner all night as a type of "white noise," but this was my only complaint.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay in St. Helena”
Reviews.Author: T02
Reviews.Content: We were pleasantly suprised with the El Bonita Motel. Of course, we did not have high expectations, but who can beat a great location, clean and spacious rooms and a pleasant back patio that opens to a grassy area. Also, it is only a 10 minute walk into St. Helena. Since it is not a full service hotel, we didn't expect too much from the front desk staff. I would recommend this place to anyone that needs a conveniently located hotel without amenities of a full service hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Sad to see it change for the worse”
Reviews.Author: sdgfone
Reviews.Content: This was my 6th and likely final time at El Bonita motel, it's been a family favorite for years. I was sorry to see how it had really gone downhill since the last time I had been there. Yes the value, compared to other lodgings in St Helena, is very good. The location is great, close to shopping and wineries and restaurants. The landscaped pool area is very nice and so is the hot tub but the sprinklers came on with no notice at 3:30 in the afternoon. I was caught off guard and my book was drenched by the time I jumped up from my lounge chair, scooped up my wet things, and ran. Wouldn't it make more sense to water in the morning or late at night when no one is using the area? The service was pretty awful at the front desk but the housekeepers are friendly and helpful. I would suggest they switch the front desk help with the housekeepers if the housekeepers spoke better English. The breakfast was just rolls and fruit, half an hour wait when they run out of coffee. The peanut butter jar was empty and really, nobody cares if you are happy or unhappy with the service. They just want you to pay and then go away and not bother them. They apparently do a lot of business with laborers who get up at 6 in the morning and talk real loud as they are getting ready for work. You hear everyones toilet flush and shower run. The chairs in the room had the stuffing coming out of the holes in the cushions and the rug was threadbare and worn in spots with tape over it. Half of the electrical outlets didn't work. My husband had plugged his cell phone in to charge and it was still dead in the morning. So it isn't really a place to relax and sleep in or lay by the pool and read or enjoy a cup of coffee in the morning or do most things you would want to do while on vacation. I'm so sorry to see it change like this. I was told they had not changed hands like I had thought after visiting this time. Perhaps they are managed from a distance? It makes me sad to think about not coming back next year.

Reviews.Title: “Great value”
Reviews.Author: 2Midwest
Reviews.Content: Despite the bad reviews the property received, I recently stayed mid-week in a unit in the back of the property (away from Highway 29). It was clean and quiet (looking out at a field). Although I did not like the ludicrous one night pre-payment policy, it was not an insurmountable issue. If you must stay in St. Helena, this is one of the better values (if not the only one). Still, I would avoid the front units since they face Highway 29 and appear noisy.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the issues.”
Reviews.Author: FoodieATL
Reviews.Content: We normally try to find budget accomendations on our trip so we can spend our money in other ways. All me and my wife are looking for is a clean room with friendly staff. The location of El Bonita is good and the room was clean, but so are a lot of other budget places in Napa Valley. I made my reservation a couple of months in advance and whoever took it had totally messed it up. They had in the wrong month and for the wrong number of nights. How you can confuse four nights in March with one in Febuary I don't know. However, mistakes happen and the real problem was the hassel I got instead of the staff just fixing the problem. They charge the first night of the room when you make your reservation as a deposit and at first they told me that I was going to lose that deposit because they messed up my reservation! I had to tell them I would stop payment on my credit card and explain they had no legal right to do that before they let that one go. Then they tried to make my pay for a room at a much higher rate then the one I had booked. I understand that sometimes reservations get messed up but the hassel they gave me instead of just fixing the problem was ridiculus. Interestingly enough, the next day we were in the lobby for about ten minutes and during that time two other people came in in which they had "lost" there reservations. These people were given similar problems to what I had experienced. It's not worth the hassel when your trying to relax on vacation. We had great experiences at the other motels we stayed at in wine country, and those places had even cheaper rooms!

Reviews.Title: “Its a Motel”
Reviews.Author: OpinionsCount
Reviews.Content: If you're looking for a great romantic getaway place, this isn't it. Its a functional motel room, nothing more. Its too bad other hotels in the area command such a high price because this hotel isn't worth what its cost was (in high season) but its soooo much cheaper than its neighbors. Don't opt for the whirlpool/jacuzzi bath upgrade because the tub was rust covered and we didn't feel comfortable using it.

Reviews.Title: “A Nice Motel”
Reviews.Author: TravelinCanuck
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here recently for a couple of nights and enjoyed it. It's right on Highway 29 just south of St. Helena. When you approach the place it looks quite ordinary and that's part of its charm. We stayed in one of the poolside rooms which is a little misleading as you have to cross the entry loop to get to the pool and spa. The room was small but comfortable and very clean. We enjoyed the pool, spa area. It was very well maintained but quite noisy as it's right beside the highway. We had a glass of wine in the garden area away from the highway where it's quieter. The continental breakfast was average. I guess what really makes this place is its location as it's close to downtown, good restaurants and some of the best wineries in Napa Valley. Bon Appetite!

Reviews.Title: “Adequate Budget Offering”
Reviews.Author: akaviva
Reviews.Content: Although clean, tidy and well located, the El Bonita would not be my first choice in Saint Helena. The Art Deco décor, while appealing, does little to compensate for the tiny rooms, lack of service and motel feel of the place. It is exceptionally well priced, however, so if you are short on funds, give it a try. After all, it’s likely you’re in Napa Valley to explore the wine country, not to sit in your motel room.

Reviews.Title: “Great place Great Price Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Shine13
Reviews.Content: This place is a great deal! It's very cute, we had a queen poolside room and it was perfect. We went off peak so it was very very cheap, but in general for the area this motel is priced amazing. The pool and jacuzzi!! are awesome and there are towels waiting for you there. The room is small but perfect, especially when you think about how much time will really be spent in it. Hopefully you are there to enjoy the wineries. The bathrooms are very very nice. El Bonita exceded my expectations! We will be staying there again this summer!

Reviews.Title: “Yes, it's fine and dandy”
Reviews.Author: LCSteve
Reviews.Content: After checking out the reviews in Trip Advisor, I decided to give the El Bonita Motel a try. Sure glad I did. It is clean and bright and cute and cozy. Yes, it's an older place, but nicely refurbished. No, it's not a "mega-sized" room, but it's certainly comfortable. For the money, especially given the location in St. Helena, it's a bargain.

Reviews.Title: “A Great little spot !”
Reviews.Author: Poozella
Reviews.Content: We visited the El Bonita this past weekend (Sept. 14-15) and had a fabulous time. I believe that this was our 3rd trip back to the El Bonita and I must say it is always a pleasure! We have stayed in Poolside rooms and the Homestead rooms and both were bright, cheery and clean. They are as pictured on their website – so there are no surprises. The rates are certainly reasonable as far as the Napa Valley is concerned. We have stayed in the $300+ a night rooms but are just as content with the El Bonita’s accommodations. It is close to many major wineries and restaurants. They offer a continental breakfast each morning consisting of fresh fruit, cereals, muffins, danish, croissants juice, coffee and tea and more. We think that it’s a great little find and will be back again ! By the way … on our visits to the wineries it was great to hear the interaction between “Trip Advisor” users … thanks for a great site !

Reviews.Title: “El Bonita is quaint and lovely.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My sister & I stayed at El Bonita Motel July 2004. What a lovely place to stay. They have beautiful roses surrounding the motel, a nice pool, continental breakfast with a sitting area that has a fireplace and an outdoor patio with a waterfall. We walked to the center of St. Helena and enjoyed the quaintness of the town. When we would return to the motel we would relax in the pool and jacuzzi. I would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “A motel .... nothing more, nothing less”
Reviews.Author: mbusa
Reviews.Content: Stayed there at the end of July, 2004... Was not so impressed with the upgraded room and lack of service in our $250 a night garden King suite. There are much better places in St Helena and you pay top dollar here if your staying in HIGH Season. This is a motel nothing more nothing less. This Place is $125 a night but when the tourists come to town and the weekends of weddings in the summer the price doubles. Room included a lite Breakfast coffee and juice with rolls and bagels. This property is close to town 10-15 min walk.

Reviews.Title: “it's a nice place”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: we stayed there when we traveled to napa. The hotel was clean and had a nice view. No complaints

Reviews.Title: “Save your money!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This little roadside motel is convenient if you are travelling through Napa Valley and have absolutely nowhere else to stay. But beware, not all the rooms are cozy & sweet as they may display on their website. The road noise is incessant, the staff is amateurish, and the amenities are basic. This would all be tolerable if these factors were reflective of average room rates, but at over $200.00 single beds during summer travel season you should expect better. Save your money for a good case of wine, the El Bonita is not worth it !

HotelInfo.Name: El Bonita Motel
HotelInfo.Address: 195 Main St., St. Helena, CA 94574
